intro: Scorzonera flaccida, commonly known as the flaccid scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in scrublands and grasslands. Scorzonera flaccida has lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with a distinctive central disk. It is sometimes cultivated for its edible roots, though it is less commonly used than other members of its genus.
